19709.<pipipi_low>「やっているね <pc>くん。\n 私も 聞き込みしてみ:
<pipipi_low>You're doing great <pc>.
I tried asking around, but alas, no luck.

19710.「なんじゃ。ルベカの探偵ごっこか。\n 子守唄について 聞きたいとは\n 何を:
What is it? Playing detective with Rubecca?
What are you looking for if you want to ask
about lullabies?

19711.「バーバサさんは 声が聞こえるとか\n 闇に呑まれるとか そういう歌詞の\n 子:
Barbasa, do you know of any lullabies with
lyrics about hearing voices or being swallowed
by darkness?

19712.「おお それは あの歌のことじゃな。\n ルベカが 小さいころに\n 唄ってやっ:
Oh, that's the song, isn't it? I think I sang
it to Rubecca when she was little.

19713.<center>ねーむれ～ よい子よ ねーむれ～。\nねーむれ～ 今すぐ ねーむ:
Slumber, my child, slumber...
Slumber right now, slumber...
If you don't sleep, I can hear you♪

19714.「昔は よう唄われとったんじゃが\n 子供たちが 気味悪がってのう。\n いつの:
It used to be sung a long time ago, but the
children found it creepy. Before I knew it,
they stopped singing it.

19715.「おまえが死ぬ。命の輝きが 闇に呑まれる……。\n そうよ。この子守唄だわ……。:
You will die. The spark of life is swallowed
by darkness. It's this lullaby...

19716.「バーバサさん その子守唄について\n 他に 知っていることは ありませんか！？:
Mr. Barbasa, do you know anything else about
that lullaby!

19717.「はて……。これを 唄ってくれた母が\n 昔 この村に立ち寄った 旅の詩人が作っ:
Well... my mother who sang this to me once
told me that it was written by a traveling
poet who stopped by this village...

19718.「その詩人は 世界を旅して回り\n 旅先で聞いた出来事なんかを もとにして\n:
The poet traveled around the world and wrote
songs based on what he heard on his travels.

19719.「……ということは この子守唄にも \n もとになった出来事か何かが\n あった:
That means there must have been some kind of
event that inspired this lullaby, right?

19720.「おそらく その詩人は レーンの村の次は\n 新たな歌の題材を探して ジュレット:
Perhaps the poet, after Lane Village, went to
Julet Town in search of a new subject for his
song.

19721.「それじゃ ジュレットのお年寄りなら\n その詩人のことを 知ってる人がいる\n:
Is it possible, then, that some elderly person
in Julet might know the poet...

19722.「ん～……。ちょっと 頼りない情報だけど \n ジュレットの町の お年寄りにも聞:
Hmmm~... a little unreliable information, but maybe you could ask some of the old folks in Julet Town to find out more about the
traveling poet.

19723.「私も行くけど だまって出かけると\n お父さん うるさいから 外出許可とってく:
I'd go with you, but your father makes too much noise if I don't, so I'm going to get permission to go out. go ahead
of me.

19724.「……これからは この女の子のことを\n 調べていこうと思うの。\n そのときは:
...From now on, I'm going to look into this
girl. When I do, please lend me your help
again.

19725.「だけど今は 早く家に帰って 休みたいわ。\n <pc>くん またね……。:
But right now I just want to go home and get
some rest. <pc> See you later...

28437.<center>おまえが死ぬと～ 聞こえる あの声～。\n命の～ 輝きが 闇に呑:
When you die~ I hear that voice. "The
brightness of life will be swallowed by
darkness. So, my dear boy...

28438.<center>名前を～ 呼ばれる その前ーに～。\nねーむれ～ 今すぐ ねーむ: Before you call my name~ Sleep~ Now, sleep~

28478.「昔を思いだして ちょっと 唄ってみようかね。:
Thinking back to the old days, let's sing a
little.

28479.<pipipi_low>「むむっ。もしかして 何か\n 手がかりを見つけたのかね:
<pipipi_low> Mmmm. Perhaps you found some
clues <pc>.

28480.「ちょっと 私に貸して。読んでみるから！: Hey, let me borrow it. I'll read it!

28481.「……ジュレットの町。立ち並ぶ貝がらの家。\n 浜辺に集う恋人たち。愛の歌。別れ:
...Julet Town. Shell houses lined up in a row. Lovers gathering on the beach. Songs of love. Songs of parting. The fragrant sea breeze.
Songs of the sea...

28482.「ふむふむ……。このノートには\n 歌の題材に なりそうなものが \n 書かれて:
Hmmm... it looks like there are some potential
subjects for songs in this notebook.

28483.「あっ そういうことね！: Oh, I see what you mean!

28485.「これは 重要な手がかりよ！\n よく 見つけだしてくれたわ。\n これは お礼:
This is an important clue! I'm so glad you
found it. Keep this as a thank you.

28486.「これが レーンの村に来た 詩人のノートなら \n あの子守唄のもとになった出来:
If this is the notebook of the poet who came to Lane Village, it must contain the events that inspired that lullaby! If we can find
it...

28488.「……レーンの村。興味深い話。\n 死を呼ぶ少女。恐れる村人。:
...Lane Village. Interesting story. Girl Calls
Death. Villagers afraid.

28489.「……名前を呼ばれて 死ぬ村人。\n 少女が使う 死の言葉とは……。:
...Villager who dies after being called by
name. The girl uses the language of death...

28490.「…………が死ぬ。命の輝き 闇に呑まれる。:
...dies. The sparkle of life is swallowed by
darkness.

28491.「これって やっぱり……。\n あれは 空耳なんかじゃ なかったんだわ……。: I knew it... it wasn't just my imagination.

28492.「……あのね <pc>。\n 変なことを言うようだけど 聞いてほしいの。:
...You know <pc>. I know this is
going to sound crazy, but I want you to hear
me out.

28493.「私のアタマの中でね。\n ときどき 女の子の声が 聞こえるの。: In my head. Sometimes I hear a girl's voice.

28494.「…………が死ぬ。\n 命の輝きが 闇に呑まれる……って。:
...will die. The spark of life is swallowed by
the darkness.

28495.「なんだか 気味が悪いし……。\n ただの空耳だって 思うようにしてた。:
It was kind of creepy... and I tried to think
it was just my imagination.

28496.「だけど 古い村人名簿から\n 女の子の名前が 消されてるのを見たとき\n すご:
But when I saw that the girl's name had been
erased from the Old Villager List, I had a bad
feeling...

28497.「昔 聴いた子守唄に アタマの中の声と\n 同じ言葉があったのを 思いだしたの！:
I remembered a lullaby I used to listen to
that had the same words as the voice in my
head!

28498.「私のアタマの中に 聞こえるのは\n たぶん この女の子の声なんだよ……。:
I think it's probably this girl's voice that I
hear in my head...

28499.「なんで 私に話しかけるの？\n この女の子は いったい 何者なの！？:
Why are you talking to me? Who the hell is
this girl?

28500.「村人名簿からも 名前が消されてるなんて\n この女の子は どうなったの……。:
I can't believe they erased her name from the
Villager's list... what happened to this
girl...
